text:
I’m really new to HubSpot, but the client I am working with has a similar issue with a bunch on unnecessary scripts being called. There is one place I sometimes find odd bits like this. If you log into HubSpot, and click on the settings icon near your profile pic / username, this will bring you to the ‘Settings’ page.

There will be a sidebar menu on the left. At the bottom, open up ‘Website’, and click on ‘Blog’.

Next, in the options that open, there will be a tab titled ‘Templates’. Clicking on that, reveals a section called ’Header HTML”.

This is another area where custom header HTML can be added to blogs. Maybe you will find the culprit there?

As a note, the other options under ‘Website’ in the sidebar, have similar spots for custom HTML

Hi! We have a simple form which was built via HubSpot’s Lead Capture forms. When users submit the form, in addition to allowing HubSpot to do whatever it does to process the form, I also need to run some code to an API, and then update the DOM based on the response.

How might I integrate my javascript into this process?
